member.name: P:Stripe.AccountRequirements.CurrentDeadline
member.summary: The date the fields in currently_due must be collected by to keep payouts enabled for the account. These fields might block payouts sooner if the next threshold is reached before these fields are collected.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountRequirements.CurrentlyDue
member.summary: The fields that need to be collected to keep the account enabled. If not collected by the current_deadline, these fields are moved to past_due and the account is disabled.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountRequirements.DisabledReason
member.summary: If the account is disabled, this string describes why the account can’t create charges or receive payouts.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountRequirements.EventuallyDue
member.summary: The fields that need to be collected assuming all volume thresholds are reached. As fields are needed, they are moved to currently_due and the current_deadline is set.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountRequirements.PastDue
member.summary: The fields that weren’t collected by the currently_due. These fields need to be collected to enable payouts for the account.

member.summary: Automatically declines certain charge types regardless of whether the card issuer accepted or declined the charge.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountSettingsCardPayments.StatementDescriptorPrefix
member.summary: The default text that appears on credit card statements when a charge is made. This field prefixes any dynamic statement_descriptor specified on the charge. statement_descriptor_prefix is useful for maximizing descriptor space for the dynamic portion.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountSettingsDashboard.DisplayName
member.summary: The display name for this account. This is used on the Stripe Dashboard to differentiate between accounts.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountSettingsDashboard.Timezone
member.summary: The timezone used in the Stripe Dashboard for this account.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountSettingsDeclineOn.AvsFailure
member.summary: Whether Stripe automatically declines charges with an incorrect ZIP or postal code. This setting only applies when a ZIP or postal code is provided and they fail bank verification.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountSettingsDeclineOn.CvcFailure
member.summary: Whether Stripe automatically declines charges with an incorrect CVC. This setting only applies when a CVC is provided and it fails bank verification.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountSettingsPayments.StatementDescriptor
member.summary: The default text that appears on credit card statements when a charge is made. This field prefixes any dynamic statement_descriptor specified on the charge.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountSettingsPayouts.DebitNegativeBalances
member.summary: A Boolean indicating if Stripe should try to reclaim negative balances from an attached bank account.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountSettingsPayouts.Schedule
member.summary: Details on when funds from charges are available, and when they are paid out to an external account.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountSettingsPayouts.StatementDescriptor
member.summary: The text that appears on the bank account statement for payouts. If not set, this efaults to the platform’s bank descriptor as set in the Dashboard.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountSettingsPayoutsSchedule.DelayDays
member.summary: The number of days charges for the account will be held before being paid out.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountSettingsPayoutsSchedule.Interval
member.summary: How frequently funds will be paid out. One of manual (payouts only created via API call), daily, weekly, or monthly.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountSettingsPayoutsSchedule.MonthlyAnchor
member.summary: The day of the month funds will be paid out. Only shown if interval is monthly. Payouts scheduled between the 29th and 31st of the month are sent on the last day of shorter months.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountSettingsPayoutsSchedule.WeeklyAnchor
member.summary: The day of the week funds will be paid out, of the style ‘monday’, ‘tuesday’, etc. Only shown if interval is weekly.

member.summary: A positive integer in the smallest currency unit (e.g., 100 cents to charge $1.00 or 100 to charge ¥100, a 0-decimal currency) representing how much to charge. The minimum amount is $0.50 US or equivalent in charge currency.

member.name: P:Stripe.Charge.AmountRefunded
member.summary: Amount in cents refunded (can be less than the amount attribute on the charge if a partial refund was issued).

member.name: P:Stripe.Charge.ApplicationFee
member.summary: The application fee (if any) for the charge. See the Connect documentation for details.

member.name: P:Stripe.Charge.ApplicationFeeAmount
member.summary: The amount of the application application fee (if any) for the charge. See the Connect documentation for details.

member.name: P:Stripe.Charge.BalanceTransactionId
member.summary: ID of the balance transaction that describes the impact of this charge on your account balance (not including refunds or disputes).

member.name: P:Stripe.Charge.BillingDetails
member.summary: Billing details of the payment method used in the payment.

member.name: P:Stripe.Charge.Captured
member.summary: If the charge was created without capturing, this boolean represents whether or not it is still uncaptured or has since been captured.

member.name: P:Stripe.Charge.Currency
member.summary: Three-letter ISO currency code representing the currency in which the charge was made.

member.name: P:Stripe.Charge.CustomerId
member.summary: ID of the customer this charge is for if one exists.

member.name: P:Stripe.Charge.Destination
member.summary: The account (if any) the charge was made on behalf of, with an automatic transfer. See the Connect documentation for details.

member.name: P:Stripe.Charge.Dispute
member.summary: Details about the dispute if the charge has been disputed.

member.name: P:Stripe.Charge.FailureCode
member.summary: Error code explaining reason for charge failure if available (see the errors section for a list of codes).

member.name: P:Stripe.Charge.FailureMessage
member.summary: Message to user further explaining reason for charge failure if available.

member.name: P:Stripe.Charge.FraudDetails
member.summary: Hash with information on fraud assessments for the charge. Assessments reported by you have the key user_report and, if set, possible values of safe and fraudulent. Assessments from Stripe have the key stripe_report and, if set, the value fraudulent.

member.name: P:Stripe.Charge.InvoiceId
member.summary: ID of the invoice this charge is for if one exists.

member.name: P:Stripe.Charge.Metadata
member.summary: A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to a charge object. It can be useful for storing additional information about the charge in a structured format.

member.name: P:Stripe.Charge.OnBehalfOfId
member.summary:
The account (if any) the charge was made on behalf of without triggering an automatic transfer. See the Connect documentation for details.
To populate the OnBehalfOf entity, you need to set ExpandOnBehalfOf to true on your service before invoking a service method.

member.name: P:Stripe.Charge.OrderId
member.summary: ID of the order this charge is for if one exists.

member.name: P:Stripe.Charge.Level3
member.summary: Details about the level III data associated with the Charge. This is a gated property and most integrations can not access it.

member.name: P:Stripe.Charge.Outcome
member.summary: Details about whether the payment was accepted, and why.

member.name: P:Stripe.Charge.Paid
member.summary: true if the charge succeeded, or was successfully authorized for later capture.

member.name: P:Stripe.Charge.PaymentIntentId
member.summary: ID of the payment intent this charge is for if one exists.

member.name: P:Stripe.Charge.PaymentMethodId
member.summary: ID of the PaymentMethod associated with this charge.

member.name: P:Stripe.Charge.PaymentMethodDetails
member.summary: Transaction-specific details of the payment method used in the payment.

member.name: P:Stripe.Charge.ReceiptEmail
member.summary: This is the email address that the receipt for this charge was sent to.

member.name: P:Stripe.Charge.ReceiptNumber
member.summary: This is the transaction number that appears on email receipts sent for this charge.

member.name: P:Stripe.Charge.ReceiptUrl
member.summary: This is the URL to view the receipt for this charge. The receipt is kept up-to-date to the latest state of the charge, including any refunds. If the charge is for an Invoice, the receipt will be stylized as an Invoice receipt.

member.name: P:Stripe.Charge.Refunded
member.summary: Whether or not the charge has been fully refunded. If the charge is only partially refunded, this attribute will still be false.

member.name: P:Stripe.Charge.Refunds
member.summary: A list of refunds that have been applied to the charge.

member.name: P:Stripe.Charge.ReviewId
member.summary: ID of the review associated with this charge if one exists.

member.name: P:Stripe.Charge.Shipping
member.summary: Shipping information for the charge.

member.name: P:Stripe.Charge.Source
member.summary: For most Stripe users, the source of every charge is a credit or debit card. This hash is then the card object describing that card.

member.name: P:Stripe.Charge.SourceTransferId
member.summary: The transfer ID which created this charge. Only present if the charge came from another Stripe account. See the Connect documentation for details.

member.name: P:Stripe.Charge.StatementDescriptor
member.summary: Extra information about a charge. This will appear on your customer’s credit card statement.

member.name: P:Stripe.Charge.Status
member.summary: The status of the payment is either succeeded, pending, or failed

member.name: P:Stripe.Charge.TransferId
member.summary: ID of the transfer to the destination account (only applicable if the charge was created using the destination parameter).

member.name: P:Stripe.Charge.TransferGroup
member.summary: A string that identifies this transaction as part of a group. See the Connect documentation for details.

member.name: P:Stripe.Outcome.NetworkStatus
member.summary: Possible values are approved_by_network, declined_by_network, not_sent_to_network, and reversed_after_approval. The value reversed_after_approval indicates the payment was blocked by Stripe after bank authorization, and may temporarily appear as “pending” on a cardholder’s statement.

member.name: P:Stripe.Outcome.Reason
member.summary: An enumerated value indicating a more detailed explanation of the outcome’s type. See understanding declines for details.

member.name: P:Stripe.Outcome.RiskLevel
member.summary: An enumerated value indicating a more detailed explanation of the outcome’s type. See understanding declines for details.

member.name: P:Stripe.Outcome.RiskScore
member.summary: Stripe’s evaluation of the riskiness of the payment. Possible values for evaluated payments are between 0 and 100.

member.name: P:Stripe.Outcome.RuleId
member.summary: The ID of the Radar rule that matched the payment, if applicable.

member.name: P:Stripe.Outcome.SellerMessage
member.summary: A human-readable description of the outcome type and reason, designed for you (the recipient of the payment), not your customer.

member.name: P:Stripe.Outcome.Type
member.summary: Possible values are authorized, issuer_declined, blocked, and invalid. See understanding declines for details.

member.name: P:Stripe.Customer.AccountBalance
member.summary: Current balance, if any, being stored on the customer’s account. If negative, the customer has credit to apply to the next invoice. If positive, the customer has an amount owed that will be added to the next invoice. The balance does not refer to any unpaid invoices; it solely takes into account amounts that have yet to be successfully applied to any invoice. This balance is only taken into account for recurring billing purposes (i.e., subscriptions, invoices, invoice items)

member.name: T:Stripe.Source
member.summary: Source objects allow you to accept a variety of payment methods. They represent a customer's payment instrument and can be used with the Source API just like a card object: once chargeable, they can be charged, or attached to customers.

member.name: P:Stripe.Source.Amount
member.summary: Amount associated with the source. This is the amount for which the source will be chargeable once ready. Required for single-use sources.

member.name: P:Stripe.Source.ClientSecret
member.summary: The client secret of the source. Used for client-side polling using a publishable key.

member.name: P:Stripe.Source.CodeVerification
member.summary: Information related to the code verification flow. Present if the source is authenticated by a verification code (flow is code_verification).

member.name: P:Stripe.Source.Currency
member.summary: The currency associated with the source. This is the currency for which the source will be chargeable once ready. Required for single-use sources.

member.name: P:Stripe.Source.Customer
member.summary: The customer to which the source is attached, if any.

member.name: P:Stripe.Source.Flow
member.summary: The authentication flow of the source. Flow is one of redirect, receiver, code_verification, none.

member.name: P:Stripe.Source.Metadata
member.summary: A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to a source object. It can be useful for storing additional information about the source in a structured format.

member.name: P:Stripe.Source.Owner
member.summary: Information about the owner of the payment instrument that may be used or required by particular source types.

member.name: P:Stripe.Source.Receiver
member.summary: Information related to the receiver flow. Present if the source is a receiver (flow is receiver).

member.name: P:Stripe.Source.Redirect
member.summary: Information related to the redirect flow. Present if the source is authenticated by a redirect (flow is redirect).

member.name: P:Stripe.Source.StatementDescriptor
member.summary: Extra information about a source. This will appear on your customer’s statement every time you charge the source.

member.name: P:Stripe.Source.Status
member.summary: The status of the charge, one of canceled, chargeable, consumed, failed, or pending. Only chargeable source objects can be used to create a charge.

member.name: P:Stripe.Source.Type
member.summary: The type of the source. The type is a payment method, one of card, three_d_secure, giropay, sepa_debit, ideal, sofort, or bancontact.

member.name: P:Stripe.Source.Usage
member.summary: One of reusable, single-use. Whether this source should be reusable or not. Some source types may or may not be reusable by construction, while other may leave the option at creation. If an incompatible value is passed, an error will be returned.

member.name: P:Stripe.SourceCodeVerification.AttemptsRemaining
member.summary: The number of attempts remaining to authenticate the source object with a verification code.

member.name: P:Stripe.SourceCodeVerification.Status
member.summary: The status of the code verification, either pending, succeeded or failed.

member.name: T:Stripe.Infrastructure.EventConverter
member.summary: This converter is used to deserialize event objects regardless of which API version they're formatted with. In the general case, Stripe.net uses a specific API version (), but events are a special case: when receiving an event object via a webhook notification, the object will be formatted with the Stripe account's default API version which may be different than Stripe.net's API version.

member.name: T:Stripe.Infrastructure.StripeObjectConverter
member.summary: This converter can be used to deserialize any Stripe object. It is mainly useful for polymorphic attributes, when the property's type is an interface instead of a concrete type. In this case, the converter will use the value of the `object` key in the JSON payload to decide which concrete type to instantiate. If no concrete type is found (or if one is found, but it's not compatible with the expected interface), then the converter returns `null`.

member.summary: Returns a list of parameters for a given value. The value can be basically anything, as long as it can be encoded in some way.
member.param: The value for which to create the list of parameters.
The key under which new keys should be nested, if any.

member.name: M:Stripe.Infrastructure.Middleware.RequestStringBuilder.FlattenParamsOptions(Stripe.INestedOptions,System.String)
member.summary: Returns a list of parameters for a given options class. If a key prefix is provided, the keys for the new parameters will be nested under the key prefix. E.g. if the key prefix `foo` is passed and the options class contains a parameter `bar`, then a parameter with key `foo[bar]` will be returned.
member.param: The options class for which to create the list of parameters.
The key under which new keys should be nested, if any.

member.name: M:Stripe.Infrastructure.Middleware.RequestStringBuilder.FlattenParamsDictionary(System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.String,System.Object},System.String)
member.summary: Returns a list of parameters for a given dictionary. If a key prefix is provided, the keys for the new parameters will be nested under the key prefix. E.g. if the key prefix `foo` is passed and the dictionary contains a key `bar`, then a parameter with key `foo[bar]` will be returned.
member.param: The dictionary for which to create the list of parameters.
The key under which new keys should be nested, if any.

member.name: M:Stripe.Infrastructure.Middleware.RequestStringBuilder.FlattenParamsList(System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Object},System.String)
member.summary: Returns a list of parameters for a given list of objects. The parameter keys will be indexed under the `keyPrefix` parameter. E.g. if the `keyPrefix` is `foo`, then the key for the first element's will be `foo[0]`, etc.
member.param: The list for which to create the list of parameters.
The key under which new keys should be nested.

member.summary: Checks if a given object is an enum. Note that nullable enums count as enums.

member.name: M:Stripe.Infrastructure.Middleware.RequestStringBuilder.NewPrefix(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Computes the new key prefix, given a key and an existing prefix (if any). E.g. if the key is `bar` and the existing prefix is `foo`, then `foo[bar]` is returned. If a key already contains nested values, then only the non-nested part is nested under the prefix, e.g. if the key is `bar[baz]` and the prefix is `foo`, then `foo[bar][baz]` is returned. If no prefix is provided, the key is returned unchanged.
member.param: The existing key prefix, if any.

member.name: P:Stripe.StripeConfiguration.SerializerSettings
member.summary: Gets or sets the settings used for deserializing JSON objects returned by Stripe's API. It is highly recommended you do not change these settings, as doing so can produce unexpected results. If you do change these settings, make sure that is among the converters, otherwise the library will no longer be able to deserialize polymorphic resources represented by interfaces (e.g. ).

For more information, see the application fees documentation.

member.summary: An optional dictionary containing a new destination amount to use. Can only be used with destination charges created with Stripe Connect.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeCaptureOptions.ReceiptEmail
member.summary: Email address that will receive an email receipt confirming the transaction.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeCaptureOptions.StatementDescriptor
member.summary: An arbitrary string to be displayed on your customer's credit card statement. This may be up to 22 characters. As an example, if your website is RunClub and the item you're charging for is a race ticket, you may want to specify a statement_descriptor of RunClub 5K race ticket. The statement description may not include <>"' characters, and will appear on your customer's statement in capital letters. Non-ASCII characters are automatically stripped. While most banks display this information consistently, some may display it incorrectly or not at all.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeCreateOptions.Amount
member.summary: A positive integer in the smallest currency unit (e.g., 100 cents to charge $1.00 or 100 to charge ¥100, a 0-decimal currency) representing how much to charge the card. The minimum amount is $0.50 US or equivalent in charge currency.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeCreateOptions.Currency
member.summary: 3-letter ISO code for currency.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeCreateOptions.ApplicationFeeAmount
member.summary: A fee in cents that will be applied to the charge and transferred to the application owner's Stripe account. To use an application fee, the request must be made on behalf of another account (using RequestOptions available on all service methods), using the Stripe-Account header, an OAuth key, or the destination parameter. For more information, see the application fees documentation.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeCreateOptions.Capture
member.summary: Whether or not to immediately capture the charge. When false, the charge issues an authorization (or pre-authorization), and will need to be captured later. Uncaptured charges expire in 7 days. For more information, see authorizing charges and settling later.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeCreateOptions.Description
member.summary: An arbitrary string which you can attach to a charge object. It is displayed when in the web interface alongside the charge. Note that if you use Stripe to send automatic email receipts to your customers, your receipt emails will include the description of the charge(s) that they are describing.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeCreateOptions.Destination
member.summary: If specified, the charge will be attributed to the destination account for tax reporting, and the funds from the charge will be transferred to the destination account.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeCreateOptions.Level3
member.summary: Extra information about the charge passing level III data to card networks

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeCreateOptions.TransferGroup
member.summary: A string that identifies this transaction as part of a group. For details, see Grouping transactions.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeCreateOptions.OnBehalfOf
member.summary: The Stripe account ID that these funds are intended for. Automatically set if you use the destination parameter. See the Connect documentation for details.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeCreateOptions.Metadata
member.summary: A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to a charge object. It can be useful for storing additional information about the customer in a structured format. It's often a good idea to store an email address in metadata for tracking later.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeCreateOptions.ReceiptEmail
member.summary: The email address to send this charge's receipt to. The receipt will not be sent until the charge is paid. If this charge is for a customer, the email address specified here will override the customer's email address. Receipts will not be sent for test mode charges. If receipt_email is specified for a charge in live mode, a receipt will be sent regardless of your email settings.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeCreateOptions.Shipping
member.summary: Shipping information for the charge. Helps prevent fraud on charges for physical goods. For more information, see the Charge object documentation.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeCreateOptions.CustomerId
member.summary: The ID of an existing customer that will be charged in this request.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeCreateOptions.StatementDescriptor
member.summary: An arbitrary string to be displayed on your customer's credit card statement. This may be up to 22 characters. As an example, if your website is RunClub and the item you're charging for is a race ticket, you may want to specify a statement_descriptor of RunClub 5K race ticket. The statement description may not include <>"' characters, and will appear on your customer's statement in capital letters. Non-ASCII characters are automatically stripped. While most banks display this information consistently, some may display it incorrectly or not at all.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeDestinationCreateOptions.Account
member.summary: ID of an existing, connected stripe account.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeDestinationOptions.Amount
member.summary: The amount to transfer to the destination account.

member.summary: Shipping information for the charge. Helps prevent fraud on charges for physical goods. For more information, see the Charge object documentation.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeUpdateOptions.TransferGroup
member.summary: A string that identifies this transaction as part of a group. transfer_group may only be provided if it has not been set. See the Connect documentation for details.

member.name: T:Stripe.DisputeListOptions
member.summary: The optional arguments you can pass. Stripe Documentation

member.name: P:Stripe.DisputeUpdateOptions.Evidence
member.summary: Evidence to upload, to respond to a dispute. Updating any field in the hash will submit all fields in the hash for review. The combined character count of all fields is limited to 150,000.

member.name: P:Stripe.DisputeUpdateOptions.Metadata
member.summary: A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to a charge object. It can be useful for storing additional information about the customer in a structured format. It's often a good idea to store an email address in metadata for tracking later.

member.name: P:Stripe.DisputeUpdateOptions.Submit
member.summary: Whether to immediately submit evidence to the bank. If false, evidence is staged on the dispute. Staged evidence is visible in the API and Dashboard, and can be submitted to the bank by making another request with this attribute set to true (the default).

member.name: P:Stripe.FileLinkCreateOptions.FileId
member.summary: The ID of the file.

member.name: P:Stripe.FileLinkSharedOptions.ExpiresAt
member.summary: A future timestamp after which the link will no longer be usable.

member.name: P:Stripe.FileLinkSharedOptions.Metadata
member.summary: Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format.

member.name: P:Stripe.FileCreateOptions.File
member.summary: REQUIRED. A file to upload. The file should follow the specifications of RFC 2388 (which defines file transfers for the multipart/form-data protocol).

member.name: P:Stripe.FileCreateOptions.Purpose
member.summary: REQUIRED. The purpose of the uploaded file. Possible values are business_logo, customer_signature, dispute_evidence, identity_document, pci_document, or tax_document_user_upload

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceCreateOptions.Billing
member.summary: One of . When charging automatically, Stripe will attempt to pay this invoice using the default source attached to the customer. When sending an invoice, Stripe will email this invoice to the customer with payment instructions. Defaults to charge_automatically.

member.summary: A list of up to 4 custom fields to be displayed on the invoice.

member.summary: REQUIRED

member.summary: The number of days from which the invoice is created until it is due. Only valid for invoices where billing=send_invoice.

member.summary: ID of the default payment method for the invoice.

member.summary: Footer to be displayed on the invoice. This can be unset by updating the value to null and then saving.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceCreateOptions.StatementDescriptor
member.summary: Extra information about a charge for the customer’s credit card statement. It must contain at least one letter. If not specified and this invoice is part of a subscription, the default statement_descriptor will be set to the first subscription item’s product’s statement_descriptor.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceCreateOptions.SubscriptionId
member.summary: The ID of the subscription to invoice. If not set, the created invoice will include all pending invoice items for the customer. If set, the created invoice will exclude pending invoice items that pertain to other subscriptions.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceCreateOptions.TaxPercent
member.summary: The percent tax rate applied to the invoice, represented as a decimal number.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceItemPeriodOptions.End
member.summary: The end of the period, which must be greater than or equal to the start.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceItemPeriodOptions.Start
member.summary: he start of the period.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceListOptions.Billing
member.summary: The billing mode of the invoice to retrieve. One of .

member.name: P:Stripe.UpcomingInvoiceListLineItemsOptions.CouponId
member.summary: The code of the coupon to apply. If subscription or subscription_items is provided, the invoice returned will preview updating or creating a subscription with that coupon. Otherwise, it will preview applying that coupon to the customer for the next upcoming invoice from among the customer’s subscriptions. The invoice can be previewed without a coupon by passing this value as an empty string.

member.name: P:Stripe.UpcomingInvoiceListLineItemsOptions.CustomerId
member.summary: REQUIRED

member.name: P:Stripe.UpcomingInvoiceListLineItemsOptions.InvoiceItems
member.summary: List of invoice items to add or update in the upcoming invoice preview.

member.name: P:Stripe.UpcomingInvoiceListLineItemsOptions.SubscriptionBillingCycleAnchor
member.summary: For new subscriptions, a future timestamp to anchor the subscription’s billing cycle. This is used to determine the date of the first full invoice, and, for plans with month or year intervals, the day of the month for subsequent invoices.For existing subscriptions, the value can only be set to now or unchanged.

member.name: P:Stripe.UpcomingInvoiceListLineItemsOptions.SubscriptionCancelAtPeriodEnd
member.summary: Boolean indicating whether this subscription should cancel at the end of the current period.

member.name: P:Stripe.UpcomingInvoiceListLineItemsOptions.SubscriptionDefaultTaxRates
member.summary: If provided, the invoice returned will preview updating or creating a subscription with those tax rates applied.

member.name: P:Stripe.UpcomingInvoiceListLineItemsOptions.SubscriptionId
member.summary: The identifier of the subscription for which you’d like to retrieve the upcoming invoice. If not provided, but a subscription_items is provided, you will preview creating a subscription with those items. If neither subscription nor subscription_items is provided, you will retrieve the next upcoming invoice from among the customer’s subscriptions.

member.name: P:Stripe.UpcomingInvoiceListLineItemsOptions.SubscriptionItems
member.summary: List of subscription items, each with an attached plan.

member.name: P:Stripe.UpcomingInvoiceListLineItemsOptions.SubscriptionProrate
member.summary: If previewing an update to a subscription, this decides whether the preview will show the result of applying prorations or not. If set, one of subscription_items or subscription, and one of subscription_items or subscription_trial_end are required.

member.name: P:Stripe.UpcomingInvoiceListLineItemsOptions.SubscriptionProrationDate
member.summary: If previewing an update to a subscription, and doing proration, subscription_proration_date forces the proration to be calculated as though the update was done at the specified time. The time given must be within the current subscription period, and cannot be before the subscription was on its current plan. If set, subscription, and one of subscription_items, or subscription_trial_end are required. Also, subscription_proration cannot be set to false.

member.name: P:Stripe.UpcomingInvoiceListLineItemsOptions.SubscriptionTaxPercent
member.summary: If provided, the invoice returned will preview updating or creating a subscription with that tax percent. If set, one of subscription_items or subscription is required.

member.name: P:Stripe.UpcomingInvoiceListLineItemsOptions.SubscriptionTrialEnd
member.summary: If provided, the invoice returned will preview updating or creating a subscription with that trial end. If set, one of subscription_items or subscription is required.

member.name: P:Stripe.UpcomingInvoiceListLineItemsOptions.SubscriptionTrialFromPlan
member.summary: Indicates if a plan’s trial_period_days should be applied to the subscription. Setting subscription_trial_end per subscription is preferred, and this defaults to false. Setting this flag to true together with subscription_trial_end is not allowed.

member.name: P:Stripe.UpcomingInvoiceOptions.CouponId

Otherwise, it will preview applying that coupon to the customer for the next upcoming invoice from among the customer’s subscriptions. The invoice can be previewed without a coupon by passing this value as an empty string.

member.name: P:Stripe.ListOptions.Limit
member.summary: A limit on the number of objects to be returned, between 1 and 100.

member.name: P:Stripe.ListOptions.StartingAfter
member.summary: A cursor for use in pagination. starting_after is an object ID that defines your place in the list. For instance, if you make a list request and receive 100 objects, ending with obj_foo, your subsequent call can include starting_after=obj_foo in order to fetch the next page of the list.

member.name: P:Stripe.ListOptions.EndingBefore
member.summary: A cursor for use in pagination. ending_before is an object ID that defines your place in the list. For instance, if you make a list request and receive 100 objects, starting with obj_bar, your subsequent call can include ending_before=obj_bar in order to fetch the previous page of the list.

member.name: P:Stripe.OrderCreateOptions.Currency
member.summary: REQUIRED: Three-letter ISO currency code, in lowercase. Must be a supported currency.

member.name: P:Stripe.OrderCreateOptions.Coupon
member.summary: A coupon code that represents a discount to be applied to this order. Must be one-time duration and in tbe same currency as the order.

member.name: P:Stripe.OrderCreateOptions.CustomerId
member.summary: The ID of an existing customer to use for this order. If provided, the customer email and shipping address will be used to create the order. Subsequently, the customer will also be charged to pay the order. If email or shipping are also provided, they will override the values retrieved from the customer object.

member.name: P:Stripe.OrderCreateOptions.Email
member.summary: The email address of the customer placing the order.

member.name: P:Stripe.OrderCreateOptions.Items
member.summary: List of items constituting the order.

member.name: P:Stripe.OrderCreateOptions.Metadata
member.summary: A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to an order object. It can be useful for storing additional information about the order in a structured format.

member.name: P:Stripe.OrderCreateOptions.Shipping
member.summary: Shipping address for the order. Required if any of the SKUs are for products that have shippable set to true.

member.name: P:Stripe.OrderItemOptions.Parent
member.summary: The ID of the SKU being ordered.

member.name: P:Stripe.OrderItemOptions.Quantity
member.summary: The quantity of this order item. When type is sku, this is the number of instances of the SKU to be ordered.

member.name: P:Stripe.OrderListOptions.Customer
member.summary: Only return orders for the given customer.

member.name: P:Stripe.OrderListOptions.Ids
member.summary: Only return orders with the given IDs.

member.name: P:Stripe.OrderListOptions.Status
member.summary: Only return orders that have the given status. One of created, paid, fulfilled, or refunded.

member.name: P:Stripe.OrderListOptions.StatusTransitions
member.summary: Only return orders that match the given status_transitions. One of canceled, fulfilled, paid or returned.

member.name: P:Stripe.OrderListOptions.UpstreamIds
member.summary: Only return orders with the given upstream order IDs.

member.name: P:Stripe.OrderPayOptions.CustomerId
member.summary: The ID of an existing customer that will be charged in this request.

member.name: P:Stripe.OrderPayOptions.SourceId
member.summary: A payment source to be charged, such as a credit card. If you also pass a customer ID, the source must be the ID of a source belonging to the customer. Otherwise, if you do not pass a customer ID, the source you provide must either be a token, like the ones returned by Stripe.js.

member.name: P:Stripe.OrderPayOptions.ApplicationFee
member.summary: A fee in cents that will be applied to the order and transferred to the application owner's Stripe account. To use an application fee, the request must be made on behalf of another account, using the Stripe-Account header or OAuth key. For more information, see the application fees documentation.

member.name: P:Stripe.OrderPayOptions.Email
member.summary: The email address of the customer placing the order. If a customer is specified, that customer's email address will be used.

member.name: P:Stripe.OrderPayOptions.Metadata
member.summary: A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to an order object. It can be useful for storing additional information about the order in a structured format.

member.name: P:Stripe.OrderUpdateOptions.Coupon
member.summary: A coupon code that represents a discount to be applied to this order. Must be one-time duration and in tbe same currency as the order.

member.name: P:Stripe.OrderUpdateOptions.Metadata
member.summary: A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to an order object. It can be useful for storing additional information about the order in a structured format.

member.name: P:Stripe.OrderUpdateOptions.SelectedShippingMethod
member.summary: The shipping method to select for fulfilling this order. If specified, must be one of the ids of a shipping method in the shipping_methods array. If specified, will overwrite the existing selected shipping method, updating items as necessary.

member.name: P:Stripe.OrderUpdateOptions.Shipping
member.summary: Tracking information once the order has been fulfilled.

member.name: P:Stripe.OrderUpdateOptions.Status
member.summary: Current order status. One of created, paid, canceled, fulfilled, or returned.

member.name: P:Stripe.OrderUpdateShippingOptions.Carrier
member.summary: The name of the carrier like USPS, UPS, or FedEx. ShippingTrackingNumber must also be set with this property.

member.name: P:Stripe.OrderUpdateShippingOptions.TrackingNumber
member.summary: The tracking number provided by the carrier. ShippingCarrier must also be set with this property.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentConfirmOptions.ClientSecret
member.summary: The client secret of the PaymentIntent. Required if a publishable key is used to confirm the payment intent.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentGetOptions.ClientSecret
member.summary: The client secret of the PaymentIntent. Required if a publishable key is used to retrieve the payment intent.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentMethodCardCreateOptions.Cvc

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentMethodCardCreateOptions.ExpMonth
member.summary: Two-digit number representing the card's expiration month.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentMethodCardCreateOptions.ExpYear
member.summary: Two- or four-digit number representing the card's expiration year.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentMethodCardCreateOptions.Number
member.summary: The card number, as a string without any separators.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentMethodCardCreateOptions.Token

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentMethodCardUpdateOptions.ExpMonth

member.summary: A short one-line description of the product, meant to be displayable to the customer.

member.name: P:Stripe.ProductSharedOptions.DeactivateOn
member.summary: An array of Connect application names or identifiers that should not be able to order the SKUs for this product.

member.summary: The product’s description, meant to be displayable to the customer.

member.name: P:Stripe.ProductSharedOptions.Images
member.summary: A list of up to 8 URLs of images for this product, meant to be displayable to the customer.

member.name: P:Stripe.ProductSharedOptions.Metadata

member.name: P:Stripe.ProductSharedOptions.PackageDimensions
member.summary: The dimensions of this product for shipping purposes. A SKU associated with this product can override this value by having its own package_dimensions.

member.name: P:Stripe.ProductSharedOptions.Shippable
member.summary: Whether this product is shipped (i.e. physical goods). Defaults to true.

member.name: P:Stripe.ProductSharedOptions.StatementDescriptor
member.summary: What appears on the customers credit card statement.

member.name: P:Stripe.ProductSharedOptions.UnitLabel
member.summary: A label that represents units of this product, such as seat(s), in Stripe and on customers’ receipts and invoices.

member.name: P:Stripe.ProductSharedOptions.Url
member.summary: A URL of a publicly-accessible webpage for this product.

member.name: P:Stripe.RefundCreateOptions.Amount
member.summary: A positive integer in cents representing how much of this charge to refund. Can refund only up to the remaining, unrefunded amount of the charge.

member.name: P:Stripe.RefundCreateOptions.ChargeId
member.summary: REQUIRED. The identifier of the charge to refund.

member.name: P:Stripe.RefundCreateOptions.Metadata
member.summary: A set of key-value pairs that you can attach to a Refund object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the refund in a structured format. You can unset individual keys if you POST an empty value for that key. You can clear all keys if you POST an empty value for metadata

member.name: P:Stripe.RefundCreateOptions.Reason
member.summary: String indicating the reason for the refund. If set, possible values are duplicate, fraudulent, and requested_by_customer. If you believe the charge to be fraudulent, specifying fraudulent as the reason will add the associated card and email to your blocklists, and will also help us improve our fraud detection algorithms.

member.name: P:Stripe.RefundCreateOptions.RefundApplicationFee
member.summary: Boolean indicating whether the application fee should be refunded when refunding this charge. If a full charge refund is given, the full application fee will be refunded. Otherwise, the application fee will be refunded in an amount proportional to the amount of the charge refunded. An application fee can be refunded only by the application that created the charge.

member.name: P:Stripe.RefundCreateOptions.ReverseTransfer
member.summary: Boolean indicating whether the transfer should be reversed when refunding this charge. The transfer will be reversed proportionally to the amount being refunded (either the entire or partial amount). A transfer can be reversed only by the application that created the charge.

member.name: P:Stripe.SkuCreateOptions.Id
member.summary: The identifier for the SKU. Must be unique. If not provided, an identifier will be randomly generated.

member.name: P:Stripe.SkuSharedOptions.Active
member.summary: Whether or not the SKU is currently available for purchase. Defaults to true.

member.name: P:Stripe.SkuSharedOptions.Attributes
member.summary: A dictionary of attributes and values for the attributes defined by the product. If, for example, a product’s attributes are ["size", "gender"], a valid SKU has the following dictionary of attributes: {"size": "Medium", "gender": "Unisex"}. This dictionary encoding is handled in a custom parser in DictionaryPlugin.cs

member.name: P:Stripe.SkuSharedOptions.Currency
member.summary: Three-letter ISO currency code, in lowercase. Must be a supported currency.

member.name: P:Stripe.SkuSharedOptions.Image
member.summary: The URL of an image for this SKU, meant to be displayable to the customer.

member.name: P:Stripe.SkuSharedOptions.Inventory

member.summary: Set of key/value pairs that you can attach to an object. It can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format.

member.name: P:Stripe.SkuSharedOptions.PackageDimensions
member.summary: The dimensions of this SKU for shipping purposes.

member.name: P:Stripe.SkuSharedOptions.Price
member.summary: The cost of the item as a positive integer in the smallest currency unit (that is, 100 cents to charge $1.00, or 100 to charge ¥100, Japanese Yen being a 0-decimal currency).

member.name: P:Stripe.SkuSharedOptions.Product
member.summary: The ID of the product this SKU is associated with. The product must be currently active.

member.summary: If the subscription schedule is active, indicates if the cancellation should be prorated. Defaults to true.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionScheduleCreateOptions.FromSubscriptionId
member.summary: Migrate an existing subscription to be managed by a subscription schedule. If this parameter is set, a subscription schedule will be created using the subscription’s plan(s), set to auto-renew using the subscription’s interval. Other parameters cannot be set since their values will be inferred from the subscription.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionScheduleCreateOptions.StartDate
member.summary: The date at which the subscription schedule starts.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionScheduleInvoiceSettingsOptions.DaysUntilDue
member.summary: The number of days from which the invoice is created until it is due. Only valid for invoices where billing=send_invoice.

member.summary: Only return subscription schedules for the given customer.

member.summary: Only return subscription schedules that have not started yet.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionSchedulePhaseItemOptions.PlanId
member.summary: Plan ID for this item.

member.summary: Define thresholds at which an invoice will be sent, and the subscription advanced to a new billing period

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionSchedulePhaseItemOptions.Quantity
member.summary: Quantity for this item.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionSchedulePhaseItemOptions.TaxRates
member.summary: Ids of the tax rates to apply to this item for a phase on the subscription schedule.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionSchedulePhaseOptions.ApplicationFeePercent
member.summary: A non-negative decimal between 0 and 100, with at most two decimal places. This represents the percentage of the subscription invoice subtotal that will be transferred to the application owner’s Stripe account.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionSchedulePhaseOptions.CouponId
member.summary: The code of the coupon to apply to this subscription. A coupon applied to a subscription will only affect invoices created for that particular subscription.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionSchedulePhaseOptions.DefaultTaxRates
member.summary: Ids of the tax rates to apply to this phase on the subscription schedule.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionSchedulePhaseOptions.EndDate
member.summary: The date at which this phase of the subscription schedule ends. If set, iterations must not be set.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionSchedulePhaseOptions.Iterations
member.summary: Integer representing the multiplier applied to the plan interval. For example, iterations=2 applied to a plan with interval=month and interval_count=3 results in a phase of duration 2 * 3 months = 6 months. If set, end_date must not be set.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionSchedulePhaseOptions.Plans
member.summary: List of configuration items, each with an attached plan, to apply during this phase of the subscription schedule.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionSchedulePhaseOptions.TaxPercent
member.summary: A non-negative decimal (with at most four decimal places) between 0 and 100. This represents the percentage of the subscription invoice subtotal that will be calculated and added as tax to the final amount each billing period. For example, a plan which charges $10/month with a tax_percent of 20.0 will charge $12 per invoice.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionSchedulePhaseOptions.Trial
member.summary: If set to true the entire phase is counted as a trial and the customer will not be charged for any fees.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionSchedulePhaseOptions.TrialEnd
member.summary: Sets the phase to trialing from the start date to this date. Must be before the phase end date, can not be combined with trial.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionScheduleReleaseOptions.PreserveCancelDate
member.summary: Keep any cancellation on the subscription that the schedule has set.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionScheduleRenewalIntervalOptions.Interval
member.summary: Interval at which to renew the subscription schedule for when it ends. Possible values are day, week, month, or year.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionScheduleRenewalIntervalOptions.Length
member.summary: Number of intervals to renew the subscription schedule for when it ends.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionScheduleSharedOptions.Billing
member.summary: One of . When charging automatically, Stripe will attempt to pay this subscription at the end of the cycle using the default source attached to the customer. When sending an invoice, Stripe will email your customer an invoice with payment instructions. Defaults to charge_automatically.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionScheduleSharedOptions.BillingThresholds
member.summary: Define thresholds at which an invoice will be sent, and the subscription advanced to a new billing period. Pass an empty string to remove previously-defined thresholds.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionScheduleSharedOptions.InvoiceSettings
member.summary: Define the default settings applied to invoices created by this subscription schedule.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionScheduleSharedOptions.Metadata
member.summary: A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to a subscription schedule object.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionScheduleSharedOptions.Phases
member.summary: List representing phases of the subscription schedule. Each phase can be customized to have different durations, plans, and coupons. If there are multiple phases, the end_date of one phase will always equal the start_date of the next phase.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionScheduleSharedOptions.RenewalBehavior
member.summary: Configures how the subscription schedule behaves when it ends. Possible values are none, release, or renew. renew will create a new subscription schedule revision by adding a new phase using the most recent phase’s plans applied to a duration set by renewal_interval. none will stop the subscription schedule and cancel the underlying subscription. release will stop the subscription schedule, but keep the underlying subscription running.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionScheduleSharedOptions.RenewalInterval
member.summary: Configuration for renewing the subscription schedule when it ends. Must be set if renewal_behavior is renew. Otherwise, must not be set.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionScheduleUpdateOptions.Prorate
member.summary: If the update changes the current phase, indicates if the changes should be prorated. Defaults to true.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionBillingThresholdsOptions.AmountGte
member.summary: Monetary threshold that triggers the subscription to advance to a new billing period.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionBillingThresholdsOptions.ResetBillingCycleAnchor
member.summary: Indicates if the billing_reason should be reset when a threshold is reached. If true, billing_reason will be updated to the date/time the threshold was last reached; otherwise, the value will remain unchanged.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionCancelOptions.InvoiceNow
member.summary: Will generate a final invoice that invoices for any un-invoiced metered usage and new/pending proration invoice items.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionCancelOptions.Prorate
member.summary: Boolean (default true). Use with a billing_cycle_anchor timestamp to determine whether the customer will be invoiced a prorated amount until the anchor date. If false, the anchor period will be free (similar to a trial).

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionCreateOptions.BackdateStartDate
member.summary: For new subscriptions, a past timestamp to backdate the subscription’s start date to. If set, the first invoice will contain a proration for the timespan between the start date and the current time. Can be combined with trials and the billing cycle anchor.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionCreateOptions.BillingCycleAnchor
member.summary: A future date to anchor the subscription’s billing cycle. This is used to determine the date of the first full invoice, and, for plans with month or year intervals, the day of the month for subsequent invoices.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionSharedOptions.ApplicationFeePercent
member.summary: A non-negative decimal between 0 and 100, with at most two decimal places. This represents the percentage of the subscription invoice subtotal that will be transferred to the application owner’s Stripe account. The request must be made with an OAuth key in order to set an application fee percentage. For more information, see the application fees documentation.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionSharedOptions.Billing
member.summary: One of . When charging automatically, Stripe will attempt to pay this subscription at the end of the cycle using the default source attached to the customer. When sending an invoice, Stripe will email your customer an invoice with payment instructions. Defaults to charge_automatically.

member.summary: Define thresholds at which an invoice will be sent, and the subscription advanced to a new billing period. Pass an empty string to remove previously-defined thresholds.

member.summary: Boolean (default true). Use with a billing_cycle_anchor timestamp to determine whether the customer will be invoiced a prorated amount until the anchor date. If false, the anchor period will be free (similar to a trial).

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionSharedOptions.TaxPercent
member.summary: A non-negative decimal (with at most four decimal places) between 0 and 100. This represents the percentage of the subscription invoice subtotal that will be calculated and added as tax to the final amount each billing period. For example, a plan which charges $10/month with a tax_percent of 20.0 will charge $12 per invoice.

This can be used to apply exactly the same proration that was previewed with upcoming invoice endpoint. It can also be used to implement custom proration logic, such as prorating by day instead of by second, by providing the time that you wish to use for proration calculations.

member.name: P:Stripe.TopupCreateOptions.SourceId
member.summary: The ID of a source to transfer funds from. For most users, this should be left unspecified which will use the bank account that was set up in the dashboard for the specified currency. In test mode, this can be a test bank token (see Testing Top-ups).

member.name: P:Stripe.TopupCreateOptions.StatementDescriptor
